HDG.IM.content: science of history doesn’t determine originary relation to history, already presupposes such a relation [digression on history]: science of history can never institute historical relation to history
HDG.IM.linkedContent: science of history doesn’t determine originary relation to history, already presupposes such a relation [digression on history]: science of history can never institute historical relation to history

HDG.IM.content: only in philosophy that essential relations to beings always take shape [but you still have not answered Nietzsche’s question]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: only in philosophy that essential relations to beings always take shape [but you still have not answered Nietzsche’s question]

HDG.IM.content: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision
HDG.IM.linkedContent: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision

HDG.IM.content: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]

HDG.BC.content: man, ready for what is always original, or knows better > universal currency of historiological science, calculating “attitude” toward history, begins w/ ascendancy of Christianity: relation to essential reckoned into otherwise calculable
HDG.BC.linkedContent: man, ready for what is always original, or knows better > universal currency of historiological science, calculating “attitude” toward history, begins w/ ascendancy of Christianity: relation to essential reckoned into otherwise calculable

HDG.BC.content: Being withholds itself from any grasping on basis of beings, denies itself every concept, every determination, illumination, in every respect for every attempt at an explanation [what about every name???]: thus Being withholds itself, withdraws: self-concealment belongs to being: Being itself “is” concealment ——Being is the most worn-out (Abgegriffenste) > [beings as testimony to Being] lay claim to Being whenever we experience beings > Being expended (in a way) in constant/multiple use in all relation to beings, but Being not used up in expenditure, remains constantly available to us [cf. Open Manifest]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being withholds itself from any grasping on basis of beings, denies itself every concept, every determination, illumination, in every respect for every attempt at an explanation [what about every name???]: thus Being withholds itself, withdraws: self-concealment belongs to being: Being itself “is” concealment ——Being is the most worn-out (Abgegriffenste) > [beings as testimony to Being] lay claim to Being whenever we experience beings > Being expended (in a way) in constant/multiple use in all relation to beings, but Being not used up in expenditure, remains constantly available to us [cf. Open Manifest]

HDG.BC.content: Being as most worn-out coin (abgegriffenste Münze), what is most self-understood, that which we constantly pay for every relation to beings: Being, most worn-out, most indifferent > even when we want Nothing, Being remains, resists expenditure/consumption > in extremity of desired annihilation of all beings, Being must appear [cf. Open Manifest, total annihilation? Being makes annihilation of beings possible]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being as most worn-out coin (abgegriffenste Münze), what is most self-understood, that which we constantly pay for every relation to beings: Being, most worn-out, most indifferent > even when we want Nothing, Being remains, resists expenditure/consumption > in extremity of desired annihilation of all beings, Being must appear [cf. Open Manifest, total annihilation? Being makes annihilation of beings possible]

HDG.BC.content: does most said in saying keep its essence secret? [why name Being?], Being keeps its essence silent, as silence, origin of language > the animal doesn’t speak: silence is impossible for it > language stands in essential relation to uniqueness of Being [Being needs man]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: does most said in saying keep its essence secret? [why name Being?], Being keeps its essence silent, as silence, origin of language > the animal doesn’t speak: silence is impossible for it > language stands in essential relation to uniqueness of Being [Being needs man]

HDG.BC.content: Plato’s anamnēsis (only speaks of our comportment toward Being of beings when in a relation where we stand to “beings”) vs. Being as what authentically remembers [?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Plato’s anamnēsis (only speaks of our comportment toward Being of beings when in a relation where we stand to “beings”) vs. Being as what authentically remembers [?]

HDG.BC.content: everything that comes into relation w/ human given a “subjective” tint > perhaps only “most modern” man is a “subject” [on whether we must subjectivize Being—very subtle way of not answering this question?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: everything that comes into relation w/ human given a “subjective” tint > perhaps only “most modern” man is a “subject” [on whether we must subjectivize Being—very subtle way of not answering this question?]

HDG.BC.content: in modernity, never before achieved “objectivity” supposed to be reached because man has become a subject > in modernity, Being anthropomorphized, we don’t come into relation w/ Being itself, only what humans represent it as [can we ever come into relation to it???], “humanize” Being
HDG.BC.linkedContent: in modernity, never before achieved “objectivity” supposed to be reached because man has become a subject > in modernity, Being anthropomorphized, we don’t come into relation w/ Being itself, only what humans represent it as [can we ever come into relation to it???], “humanize” Being

HDG.BC.content: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]

HDG.TB.content: our task: trace Being to its own from Appropriation (w/out regard to relation of Being to beings) [beyond ontological difference? beyond metaphysics?], think Being w/ out regard to metaphysics > but regard for metaphysics still prevails, thus our task is to cease all overcoming [of metaphysics], leave metaphysics to itself
HDG.TB.linkedContent: our task: trace Being to its own from Appropriation (w/out regard to relation of Being to beings) [beyond ontological difference? beyond metaphysics?], think Being w/ out regard to metaphysics > but regard for metaphysics still prevails, thus our task is to cease all overcoming [of metaphysics], leave metaphysics to itself

HDG.BT.content: Dasein in relation to its past: ‘historizes’ out of its future on each occasion
HDG.BT.linkedContent: Dasein in relation to its past: ‘historizes’ out of its future on each occasion

HDG.IWM.content: metaphysics as barrier that refuses human beings primordial relation (anfänglichen Bezug) of Being to the human essence [cf. 281n X Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: metaphysics as barrier that refuses human beings primordial relation (anfänglichen Bezug) of Being to the human essence [cf. 281n X Being]

HDG.IWM.content: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]

HDG.IWM.content: thinking attempted in Being and Time is “under way (unterwegs)” toward bringing thinking onto a way, toward opening a path for thinking [not there yet, telos, preparatory, provisional] > how could this conjecture (experienced here [really???]), that relation of Being to human essence belongs to Being itself, become explicit before every attempt to liberate Dasein from subjectivity, etc. [had to go through destruction via meaning of Being to think truth of Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: thinking attempted in Being and Time is “under way (unterwegs)” toward bringing thinking onto a way, toward opening a path for thinking [not there yet, telos, preparatory, provisional] > how could this conjecture (experienced here [really???]), that relation of Being to human essence belongs to Being itself, become explicit before every attempt to liberate Dasein from subjectivity, etc. [had to go through destruction via meaning of Being to think truth of Being]

HDG.IWM.content: “understanding”: relation that tries to enter into relation of truth of Being to human essence, ecstatic, thrown projection, standing in realm of the open > realm that opens for us in projection is called meaning > “Meaning of Being” says same as “truth of Being” [not identical?]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: “understanding”: relation that tries to enter into relation of truth of Being to human essence, ecstatic, thrown projection, standing in realm of the open > realm that opens for us in projection is called meaning > “Meaning of Being” says same as “truth of Being” [not identical?]

HDG.QB.content: transcendence ambiguous for essential reasons w/in metaphysics > meanings of transcendence: 1) relation proceeding from beings & passing over to being 2) relation leading from changeable beings to an entity that is at rest 3) supreme entity itself > meta-physical in metaphysics = transcendence
HDG.QB.linkedContent: transcendence ambiguous for essential reasons w/in metaphysics > meanings of transcendence: 1) relation proceeding from beings & passing over to being 2) relation leading from changeable beings to an entity that is at rest 3) supreme entity itself > meta-physical in metaphysics = transcendence

HDG.QB.content: to what extent essence of “being” is intrinsically a relation to human essence? [Being needs humans]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: to what extent essence of “being” is intrinsically a relation to human essence? [Being needs humans]

HDG.QB.content: algos (pain) related to alegō, the intensivum of legō, means intimate gathering: pain as that which gathers most intimately: Hegel’s concept of “concept,” “strenuous effort” it entails
HDG.QB.linkedContent: algos (pain) related to alegō, the intensivum of legō, means intimate gathering: pain as that which gathers most intimately: Hegel’s concept of “concept,” “strenuous effort” it entails

HDG.QB.content: crossing the line entails a transformation of our saying (Sagen), demands a transformed relation to essence of language? > if you, Jünger, represent language of sciences as nominalism, mustn’t you characterize your own relation to language differently?
HDG.QB.linkedContent: crossing the line entails a transformation of our saying (Sagen), demands a transformed relation to essence of language? > if you, Jünger, represent language of sciences as nominalism, mustn’t you characterize your own relation to language differently?

HDG.FS.content: that opposite of monde means impure (immonde) preserves something of Heraclitus’ “world” > fundamental relation of Greek language to nature: leaving nature open in its radiance (Strahlenden) vs. modern era: making nature’s appearances easily calculable
HDG.FS.linkedContent: that opposite of monde means impure (immonde) preserves something of Heraclitus’ “world” > fundamental relation of Greek language to nature: leaving nature open in its radiance (Strahlenden) vs. modern era: making nature’s appearances easily calculable

HDG.FS.content: philosophy as an attempt at conjoining, Parmenides’ en, the being of beings, being not an empty word, exchangeable currency, always concretely apprehended as present (Gegenwart), as presence (Anwesenheit)—what is relation btwn presence/unity?
HDG.FS.linkedContent: philosophy as an attempt at conjoining, Parmenides’ en, the being of beings, being not an empty word, exchangeable currency, always concretely apprehended as present (Gegenwart), as presence (Anwesenheit)—what is relation btwn presence/unity?

HDG.FS.content: [Kant’s] understanding incapable of understanding how limitations at heart of reason, abolished once referred to absolute, are produced in this “abolishing” relation (“vernichtenden” Bezug): there is “appeasement (Befriedigung)”: fixities disappear, while oppositions appear in their vitality (Lebendigkeit)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [Kant’s] understanding incapable of understanding how limitations at heart of reason, abolished once referred to absolute, are produced in this “abolishing” relation (“vernichtenden” Bezug): there is “appeasement (Befriedigung)”: fixities disappear, while oppositions appear in their vitality (Lebendigkeit)

HDG.FS.content: [deconstructive method?] formulating question of Being in relation to Hegel can only be done on basis of Hegel’s text
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [deconstructive method?] formulating question of Being in relation to Hegel can only be done on basis of Hegel’s text

HDG.FS.content: relation btwn ontology & difference of being/beings can’t be taken up by metaphysics [overcoming metaphysics] > can’t think the foundation (Begründung), only its consequence (Folge): horizon in which ontological difference treated can’t appear as explicit them of ontology [ontology & metaphysics are here linked]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: relation btwn ontology & difference of being/beings can’t be taken up by metaphysics [overcoming metaphysics] > can’t think the foundation (Begründung), only its consequence (Folge): horizon in which ontological difference treated can’t appear as explicit them of ontology [ontology & metaphysics are here linked]

HDG.FS.content: difficult to accomplish anew what Greeks did when they thought Being as an appearing outside concealment (phusis), still we ask: what occurs in fact of arising-into-alētheia? > the overabundance (Überfülle), the excess (Übermass) of what presences (Anwesende), thus why Thales can only look to the heavens, relation to this thrust of presence is thaumazein [wonder] [height & excess] > in extreme opposition, when astronauts landed on moon, moon as moon disappeared, only a calculable parameter (Rechnungsgrösse) for technological enterprise of humans
HDG.FS.linkedContent: difficult to accomplish anew what Greeks did when they thought Being as an appearing outside concealment (phusis), still we ask: what occurs in fact of arising-into-alētheia? > the overabundance (Überfülle), the excess (Übermass) of what presences (Anwesende), thus why Thales can only look to the heavens, relation to this thrust of presence is thaumazein [wonder] [height & excess] > in extreme opposition, when astronauts landed on moon, moon as moon disappeared, only a calculable parameter (Rechnungsgrösse) for technological enterprise of humans

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger calls analysis of temporality of Dasein a non-metaphysical thinking of time > time no longer series of now moments, but horizon for understanding of being > analytic of Dasein provides equipment making possible sense of being in non-metaphysical signification: destruction achieves its goal (ihr Ziel gebracht) [?????]—but, various coverings of originary sense of being maintain essential relation to what they cover over, so that metaphysics can be read positively, transformations of original meaning all belonging to single destiny—Seinsgeschick
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger calls analysis of temporality of Dasein a non-metaphysical thinking of time > time no longer series of now moments, but horizon for understanding of being > analytic of Dasein provides equipment making possible sense of being in non-metaphysical signification: destruction achieves its goal (ihr Ziel gebracht) [?????]—but, various coverings of originary sense of being maintain essential relation to what they cover over, so that metaphysics can be read positively, transformations of original meaning all belonging to single destiny—Seinsgeschick

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger on movedness (Bewegtheit), central to Aristotle’s Physics, but not in Kant’s table of categories: Kant didn’t unfold relation of movedness to being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger on movedness (Bewegtheit), central to Aristotle’s Physics, but not in Kant’s table of categories: Kant didn’t unfold relation of movedness to being

HDG.FS.content: the 2 possibilities of end of physics: 1) open to entirely new relation to nature 2) after research concludes settle into thoughtless exploitation (gedankenlosen Ausbeutung) of the discovery (Entdeckung)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: the 2 possibilities of end of physics: 1) open to entirely new relation to nature 2) after research concludes settle into thoughtless exploitation (gedankenlosen Ausbeutung) of the discovery (Entdeckung)

HDG.FS.content: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through
HDG.FS.linkedContent: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through

HDG.FS.content: man is plaything of technology, positionality (Ge-stell) requires man to correspond w/ exploitation/consumption > cybernetics becomes replacement for philosophy/poetry > modern man a slave to forgetfulness of Being, when disciplines (human sciences) bear no relation to their ground
HDG.FS.linkedContent: man is plaything of technology, positionality (Ge-stell) requires man to correspond w/ exploitation/consumption > cybernetics becomes replacement for philosophy/poetry > modern man a slave to forgetfulness of Being, when disciplines (human sciences) bear no relation to their ground

HDG.FS.content: surrender consciousness, join new domain (Bereich) of Dasein, must step into it, enter it, to stand in relation to what isn’t man > entry into this domain not produced by thought undertaken by Heidegger: to believe thinking capable of changing place of man, still conceive it (vorstellen) on model of production (Produktion); rather, thinking prepares man for possibility (Möglichkeit) of corresponding to such an entry (Einkehr) [so attention is delayed!]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: surrender consciousness, join new domain (Bereich) of Dasein, must step into it, enter it, to stand in relation to what isn’t man > entry into this domain not produced by thought undertaken by Heidegger: to believe thinking capable of changing place of man, still conceive it (vorstellen) on model of production (Produktion); rather, thinking prepares man for possibility (Möglichkeit) of corresponding to such an entry (Einkehr) [so attention is delayed!]

HDG.CCP.content: non-willing: 1) willingly to renounce willing 2) what remains absolutely outside any kind of will > these 2 stand in definite relation to each other > what moves our conversation claims my attention, challenges me
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: non-willing: 1) willingly to renounce willing 2) what remains absolutely outside any kind of will > these 2 stand in definite relation to each other > what moves our conversation claims my attention, challenges me

HDG.CCP.content: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]

HDG.CCP.content: being released from our transcendental relation is 1st aspect of releasement [destruction 1st, but then what?] > but an authentic Gelassenheit wouldn’t necessarily be preceded by this release (from horizontal transcendence)
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: being released from our transcendental relation is 1st aspect of releasement [destruction 1st, but then what?] > but an authentic Gelassenheit wouldn’t necessarily be preceded by this release (from horizontal transcendence)

HDG.CCP.content: relation btwn Gegnet and Gelassenheit, neither ontic nor ontological: only thought as regioning
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: relation btwn Gegnet and Gelassenheit, neither ontic nor ontological: only thought as regioning

HDG.CCP.content: relation of Gegnet to thing: determining (Bedingnis) (not making/effecting or rendering possible) > to learn [to hear] determining must wait upon it & regioning w/ respect to man
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: relation of Gegnet to thing: determining (Bedingnis) (not making/effecting or rendering possible) > to learn [to hear] determining must wait upon it & regioning w/ respect to man

HDG.CCP.content: (only an assertion re: relation of truth to man) truth remains independent of man: Gegnet uses man’s nature (Gelassenheit to Gegnet) w/ respect to man and to sustain determining [of things] [Schelling on independence in Investiga…Human Freedom] > man is he who’s made use of nature of truth
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: (only an assertion re: relation of truth to man) truth remains independent of man: Gegnet uses man’s nature (Gelassenheit to Gegnet) w/ respect to man and to sustain determining [of things] [Schelling on independence in Investiga…Human Freedom] > man is he who’s made use of nature of truth

HDG.DL.content: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

HDG.DL.content: language defines (bestimmt) the hermeneutic relation: go right on releasing (entlassen) into open whatever might be said (not a non-committal drifting away)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: language defines (bestimmt) the hermeneutic relation: go right on releasing (entlassen) into open whatever might be said (not a non-committal drifting away)

HDG.DL.content: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold
HDG.DL.linkedContent: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

HDG.DL.content: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other
HDG.DL.linkedContent: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

HDG.DL.content: Heidegger associates phenomenological experience (Erlebnis) w/ “consciousness,” subject/object, refers life back to “I” > Heidegger tried to leave this experience behind in hermeneutic relation of two-fold [Heidegger affirms Erfahrung over Erlebnis?], but “nobody can in just one single leap take distance from the predominant circle of ideas,” especially re: well-worn tracks (langem eingefahrenen Bahnen)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Heidegger associates phenomenological experience (Erlebnis) w/ “consciousness,” subject/object, refers life back to “I” > Heidegger tried to leave this experience behind in hermeneutic relation of two-fold [Heidegger affirms Erfahrung over Erlebnis?], but “nobody can in just one single leap take distance from the predominant circle of ideas,” especially re: well-worn tracks (langem eingefahrenen Bahnen)

HDG.DL.content: two-fold has already offered itself (sich angeboten) to man, though its nature remains veiled > man, insofern er Mensch ist, listens (hört) to this message > man is used for hearing it > man stands in a relation > relation is called hermeneutical: brings tidings (Kunde) of message
HDG.DL.linkedContent: two-fold has already offered itself (sich angeboten) to man, though its nature remains veiled > man, insofern er Mensch ist, listens (hört) to this message > man is used for hearing it > man stands in a relation > relation is called hermeneutical: brings tidings (Kunde) of message

HDG.DL.content: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)

HDG.DL.content: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]

HDG.DL.content: are we not attempting the impossible (Unmögliche)? Allerdings — solange dem Menschen nicht jener Botengang rein gewährt ist , den die Botschaft braucht, die dem Menschen die Entbergung der Zwiefalt zuspricht [basically he says: so long as we have not been given the pure gift of messaging to course through the usage of message that grants us the unconcealment of the two-fold] > veiled relation (Verhältnis) btwn message & messenger’s course plays (spielt) everywhere [play of the trace]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: are we not attempting the impossible (Unmögliche)? Allerdings — solange dem Menschen nicht jener Botengang rein gewährt ist , den die Botschaft braucht, die dem Menschen die Entbergung der Zwiefalt zuspricht [basically he says: so long as we have not been given the pure gift of messaging to course through the usage of message that grants us the unconcealment of the two-fold] > veiled relation (Verhältnis) btwn message & messenger’s course plays (spielt) everywhere [play of the trace]

HDG.LP.content: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets

HDG.LP.content: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]

HDG.LP.content: “softly (leise)” always leads us softly to essential relations (wesenhaften Bezüge) > pain conceals itself in stone (petrifying pain) > silent glow of 1st dawn (earliest, ancient origin [uralte Herkunft]), the prior beginning coming toward everything that is becoming (Werdende), brings it to the never-to-be-obtained arrival [the never-arriving arrival] (nie einholbare Ankunft) of its essential being
HDG.LP.linkedContent: “softly (leise)” always leads us softly to essential relations (wesenhaften Bezüge) > pain conceals itself in stone (petrifying pain) > silent glow of 1st dawn (earliest, ancient origin [uralte Herkunft]), the prior beginning coming toward everything that is becoming (Werdende), brings it to the never-to-be-obtained arrival [the never-arriving arrival] (nie einholbare Ankunft) of its essential being

HDG.WL.content: a web compresses, obstructs the straight clear view (gerade Durchsicht) in its mesh (Verflochtenen) [condensation] > we can’t disregard web of language, what seems its hopeless tangle > attempt to loosen the web to view the “open togetherness (freie Zusammengehören) of the relations named in the formula”: try to experience unbinding bond (entbindende Band) in web of language
HDG.WL.linkedContent: a web compresses, obstructs the straight clear view (gerade Durchsicht) in its mesh (Verflochtenen) [condensation] > we can’t disregard web of language, what seems its hopeless tangle > attempt to loosen the web to view the “open togetherness (freie Zusammengehören) of the relations named in the formula”: try to experience unbinding bond (entbindende Band) in web of language

HDG.WL.content: acc. Aristotle [classical architectonic (Baugefüge) structure of language], letters show sounds, sounds show passions of soul, passions of soul show matters that arouse them (be-treffenden Sachen) > showing (Zeigen) holds up this classical structure > relation btwn Showing and what it shows (Gezeigten) becomes conventional relation btwn sign (Zeichen) & its signification (Bezeichnetem) > transformation (Änderung) of sign from something that shows (Zeigenden) to something that designates (Bezeichnenden): a change in the nature of truth
HDG.WL.linkedContent: acc. Aristotle [classical architectonic (Baugefüge) structure of language], letters show sounds, sounds show passions of soul, passions of soul show matters that arouse them (be-treffenden Sachen) > showing (Zeigen) holds up this classical structure > relation btwn Showing and what it shows (Gezeigten) becomes conventional relation btwn sign (Zeichen) & its signification (Bezeichnetem) > transformation (Änderung) of sign from something that shows (Zeigenden) to something that designates (Bezeichnenden): a change in the nature of truth

HDG.WL.content: to pursue Sprachwesen in thought, a change of Sprache is necessary that we can’t compel/invent, can’t just procure new words/phrases > concerns our relation to language, which is determined by destiny [how will language retain us in Ereignis?] : our Saying (always an answering) forever relational
HDG.WL.linkedContent: to pursue Sprachwesen in thought, a change of Sprache is necessary that we can’t compel/invent, can’t just procure new words/phrases > concerns our relation to language, which is determined by destiny [how will language retain us in Ereignis?] : our Saying (always an answering) forever relational

HDG.WL.content: we might prepare for this change in our relation (Bezuges) to language, perhaps this experience might awaken [arrival?]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: we might prepare for this change in our relation (Bezuges) to language, perhaps this experience might awaken [arrival?]

HDG.EC.content: in accustomed translation of mortality, it’s the relation to death, not to the immortals, that is named > only man, not animal, knows death, can go towards death > animal cannot die, cannot have death
HDG.EC.linkedContent: in accustomed translation of mortality, it’s the relation to death, not to the immortals, that is named > only man, not animal, knows death, can go towards death > animal cannot die, cannot have death

HDG.EC.content: we are used/needed ( as the string sounding the primordial play of the world, the most ancient provenance (Herkunft) > this instrument is aptly (shicklich) taken up/preserved (aufgehoben) im Veroborgenen > is not answer (Antwort), even in word (Wort), the selfsame as Gegenwart ——Gegenwart is related to time, Antwort related to word, so that time & word are more intimately kindred (verschwistert) than we have presaged (ahnen)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: we are used/needed ( as the string sounding the primordial play of the world, the most ancient provenance (Herkunft) > this instrument is aptly (shicklich) taken up/preserved (aufgehoben) im Veroborgenen > is not answer (Antwort), even in word (Wort), the selfsame as Gegenwart ——Gegenwart is related to time, Antwort related to word, so that time & word are more intimately kindred (verschwistert) than we have presaged (ahnen)

HDG.OHF.content: hermeneutics from ermēneuein (interpreting), related to god Hermes
hermeneutics [via Theaetetus 209a5]: “announcement and making known (Kundgabe) of the being of a being in relation to…(me)”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermeneutics [via Theaetetus 209a5]: “announcement and making known (Kundgabe) of the being of a being in relation to…(me)”

HDG.OHF.content: acc. Scheler, Luther first to describe man as flesh (caro) [confusing Luther w/ prophet Isaiah (40:6)], flesh as corruption, definitively negative relation to God (man stands against God)—this is constitutive! [Christianity]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: acc. Scheler, Luther first to describe man as flesh (caro) [confusing Luther w/ prophet Isaiah (40:6)], flesh as corruption, definitively negative relation to God (man stands against God)—this is constitutive! [Christianity]

HDG.OHF.content: relation of definitions of classificatory order: not one and then the other, but one is defined as that which belongs to the other [hetero-tautology], in itself it is the other as well, all others: (Welche Vorhabe? die des Wegsehens!) > the as-well-as (Sowohl-als auch), fundamental formal/categorial structure, limitlessness of its universality [bad infinity?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: relation of definitions of classificatory order: not one and then the other, but one is defined as that which belongs to the other [hetero-tautology], in itself it is the other as well, all others: (Welche Vorhabe? die des Wegsehens!) > the as-well-as (Sowohl-als auch), fundamental formal/categorial structure, limitlessness of its universality [bad infinity?]
